items.content_html: I excitedly signed up for the Ulysses 13 beta today. The feature I am most looking forward to is ‚Äúimproved code blocks with syntax highlighting‚Äù. If they provide Swift syntax highlighting in code blocks, I can finally use it for a proper developer‚Äôs log.
I deactivated by Facebook account today. I can‚Äôt muster up the gumption to delete it, and don‚Äôt know why. But it‚Äôs a start.
I‚Äôm trying to catch up to current Red Sox games on MLB At Bat. I‚Äôm still a few days behind. It‚Äôs a losing battle every baseball season, because the games are so long.
Somehow my simple feature update in my app ballooned to a 38-file refactor. üò≥ I‚Äôm in a better position now for a number of additional little updates now, thanks to the the extra work.

The spring cleanup landscaping quotes I got this week have a range of $1,400 for the same work. It really pays to shop around, I guess. Fortunately, my current lawnmowing company put in the lowest quote and can do the work the soonest.
üéµ ‚ÄúSpace Gun‚Äù by Guided by Voices sounds just as good and just as vital as their old stuff.

My current background task, while I work, is secure erasing a bunch of old, small, unneeded hard drives, to prepare them for recycling. I wish I had encrypted them, to avoid all the wait time ahead of me, but that wasn‚Äôt really an option back when I used them.
Sometimes you can program on your hobby projects after work, but sometimes you have to clean house. April is a clean-house kind of month for me.
üéµ I‚Äôm really digging Bleachers‚Äô ‚ÄúGone Now‚Äù right now. I like everything that Jack Antonoff does.
I‚Äôm getting back in the swing of things at work now. I‚Äôm in the groove. Here‚Äôs to a productive week.
SwiftoDo 2.11.2 is now available in the App Store. No new features this time, but the code has been updated to Swift 4.1.
Today is a rebuilding day after 2 days in NYC. The city is fun but we are all happy to be back at home.
I was not happy to learn today that OPPO Digital is going out of business. They make my absolute favorite headphones, the OPPO PM-3. üéßüò•
It may be too soon to tell, but I‚Äôm afraid Digby Forever has ruined my life.

üéµ I re-listened to The Decemberists‚Äô I‚Äôll Be Your Girl today, and was surprised that all the songs sounded like I had always known them. I enjoyed the album a lot more today than on my first listen.
Did you know you can filter Excel spreadsheet columns by color? You sure can! It came in handy today.

Someone just tried to hack into my Apple account. Scary! I‚Äôm glad I have two factor authentication turned on. I got notifications on all my devices and quickly changed my password for the first time in a couple years. I wonder what happened.
Our plans today include Easter egg dying and a Passover Seder with family. I prefer brisket to Easter ham any day.
We‚Äôre going to Six Flags Great Adventure today on the first warm-ish day of spring. I‚Äôm excited. We‚Äôll see how it is. I‚Äôve never gone there before.

My Mac came back from the stalled OS update, but I decided to nuke the hard drive and reinstall macOS anyway. Too many little things have been broken lately. It‚Äôs the first time I have done so on this machine ever. I‚Äôve had it almost 5 years. ü§û

SwiftoDo 2.11.1 is now available in the App Store. It improves hardware keyboard support in the task list and task editor. Now you can type the first character to make picking priority, project, and context faster.
Once again, a macOS point update has stalled on my old MacBook Pro. It has been stuck for nearly 8 hours. I guess I will force reboot (later) and cross my fingers that it comes back to life.
Hot take: Swift 4.1 is .1 better than Swift 4.

It‚Äôs a big Apple software update day today! iOS 11.3 and Xcode 9.3 finally were released. I hope the new Xcode works out more of the Swift-related kinks. Xcode 9.2 still can‚Äôt jump to many of my method definitions, and I‚Äôve never understood why.
There‚Äôs nothing quite like learning new T-SQL commands. I‚Äôm learning more about window functions, such as LAST VALUE today. The reason? Messed up data that we are dealing with.
